00062         ## libtool file builder
00063         def la_file(target, source, env):
00064                 dest=open(target[0].path, 'w')
00065                 sname=source[0].name
00066                 dest.write("dlname='%s'\n" % sname)
00067                 dest.write("library_names='%s %s %s'\n" % (sname, sname, sname))
00068                 dest.write("old_library=''\n")
00069                 dest.write("dependency_libs=''\n")
00070                 dest.write("current=0\n")
00071                 dest.write("age=0\n")
00072                 dest.write("revision=0\n")
00073                 dest.write("installed=yes\n")
00074                 dest.write("shouldnotlink=no\n")
00075                 dest.write("dlopen=''\n")
00076                 dest.write("dlpreopen=''\n")
00077                 dest.write("libdir='%s'" % (env['PREFIX']+"/lib") )
00078                 dest.close()
00079                 return 0
00080 
00081                 LA_BUILDER = env.Builder(
00082                         action     = la_file,
00083                         suffix     = '.la',
00084                         src_suffix = env['SHLIBSUFFIX'])
00085 
00086                 env['BUILDERS']['LaFile']    = LA_BUILDER

00095         def make_list(e):
00096                 if type(e) is types.ListType:
00097                         return e
00098                 else:
00099                         return e.split()
00100 
00101         def G_files(lenv, target, source):
00102                 return make_list(source)
00103 
00104         import glob
00105         def G_install(lenv, restype, subdir, files):
00106                 if not env['_INSTALL']:
00107                         return
00108                 basedir=env['DESTDIR']
00109                 if len(restype)>0:
00110                         if not lenv.has_key(restype):
00111                                 print RED+"unknown resource type "+restype+NORMAL
00112                         else:
00113                                 basedir += lenv[restype]+'/'
00114                 #print file # <- useful to trace stuff :)
00115                 install_list =  env.Install(basedir+subdir+'/', make_list(files) )
00116                 env.Alias('install', install_list)
00117                 return install_list
00118 
00119         def G_installas(lenv, restype, destfile, file):
00120                 if not env['_INSTALL']:
00121                         return
00122                 basedir=env['DESTDIR']
00123                 if len(restype)>0:
00124                         if not lenv.has_key(restype):
00125                                 print RED+"unknown resource type "+restype+NORMAL
00126                         else:
00127                                 basedir += lenv[restype]+'/'
00128                 install_list = env.InstallAs(basedir+destfile, file)
00129                 env.Alias('install', install_list)
00130                 return install_list
00131 
00132         def G_program(lenv, target, source):
00133                 """ Makes a kde program
00134                 The program is installed except if one sets env['NOAUTOINSTALL'] """
00135                 src = G_files(lenv, target, source)
00136                 program_list = lenv.Program(target, src)
00137                 if not lenv.has_key('NOAUTOINSTALL'):
00138                         G_install(lenv, 'BINDIR', '', target)
00139                 return program_list
00140 
00141         def G_shlib(lenv, target, source, kdelib=0, libprefix='lib'):
00142                 """ Makes a shared library for kde (.la file for klibloader)
00143                 The library is installed except if one sets env['NOAUTOINSTALL'] """
00144                 src = G_files(lenv, target, source)
00145                 lenv['LIBPREFIX']=libprefix
00146                 library_list = lenv.SharedLibrary(target, src)
00147                 lafile_list  = lenv.LaFile(target, library_list)
00148                 if not lenv.has_key('NOAUTOINSTALL'):
00149                         install_dir = 'LIBDIR'
00150                         if kdelib==1:
00151                                 install_dir = 'LIBDIR'
00152                         G_install(lenv, install_dir, '', library_list)
00153                         G_install(lenv, install_dir, '', lafile_list)
00154                 return library_list
00155 
00156         def G_staticlib(lenv, target, source):
00157                 """ Makes a static library for kde - in practice you should not use static libraries
00158                 1. they take more memory than shared ones
00159                 2. makefile.am needed it because of limitations
00160                 (cannot handle sources in separate folders - takes extra processing) """
00161                 src = G_files(lenv, target, source)
00162                 return lenv.StaticLibrary(target, src)
00163                 # do not install static libraries by default
00164 
00165         def G_addflags_c(lenv, fl):
00166                 """ Compilation flags for C programs """
00167                 lenv.AppendUnique(CCFLAGS = make_list(fl))
00168 
00169         def G_addflags_link(lenv, fl):
00170                 """ Add link flags - Use this if G_addlibs below is not enough """
00171                 lenv.AppendUnique(LINKFLAGS = make_list(fl))
00172 
00173         def G_addlibs(lenv, libs):
00174                 """ Helper function """
00175                 lenv.AppendUnique(LIBS = make_list(libs))
00176 
00177         def G_addpaths_includes(lenv, paths):
00178                 """ Add new include paths """
00179                 lenv.AppendUnique(CPPPATH = make_list(paths))
00180 
00181         def G_addpaths_libs(lenv, paths):
00182                 """ Add paths to libraries """
00183                 lenv.AppendUnique(LIBPATH = make_list(paths))
00184 
00185         def subdirs(lenv, folderlist):
00186                 flist=make_list(folderlist)
00187                 for i in flist:
00188                         lenv.SConscript(i+"/SConscript")
00189 
00190         def Use(lenv, flags):
00191                 _flags=make_list(flags)
00192                 if 'environ' in _flags:
00193                         ## The scons developers advise against using this but it is mostly innocuous :)
00194                         import os
00195                         lenv.AppendUnique( ENV = os.environ )
00196                 if not 'lang_qt' in _flags:
00197                         ## Use this define if you are using the kde translation scheme (.po files)
00198                         lenv.Append( CPPFLAGS = '-DQT_NO_TRANSLATION' )
00199                 if 'rpath' in _flags:
00200                         ## Use this to set rpath - this may cause trouble if folders are moved (chrpath)
00201                         lenv.Append( RPATH = [lenv['PREFIX']+'/lib'] )
00202                 if 'thread' in _flags:
00203                         ## Uncomment the following if you need threading support
00204                         lenv.G_addflags_cxx( ['-DQT_THREAD_SUPPORT', '-D_REENTRANT'] )
00205                 if not 'nohelp' in _flags:
00206                         if lenv['_CONFIGURE'] or lenv['HELP']:
00207                                 env.Exit(0)
00208 
00209         from SCons.Script.SConscript import SConsEnvironment
00210         SConsEnvironment.G_program = G_program
00211         SConsEnvironment.G_shlib = G_shlib
00212         SConsEnvironment.G_staticlib = G_staticlib
00213         SConsEnvironment.G_install = G_install
00214         SConsEnvironment.G_installas = G_installas
00215 
00216         SConsEnvironment.G_addflags_c = G_addflags_c
00217         SConsEnvironment.G_addflags_link = G_addflags_link
00218         SConsEnvironment.G_addlibs = G_addlibs
00219         SConsEnvironment.G_addpaths_includes = G_addpaths_includes
00220         SConsEnvironment.G_addpaths_libs = G_addpaths_libs      
00221         
00222         SConsEnvironment.Use = Use
00223         SConsEnvironment.subdirs = subdirs
